body_html:
I got the same problem with import tensorflow.contrib.keras as K resulting in identical error message as being reported here.
System and related details:
Linux Mint 18.2; TF r1.2; Python 3.6

And indeed changing the decimal separator made everything work as it supposed.
1/ edit locale file located /usr/share/i18n/locales/

LC_NUMERIC
decimal_point   "<U002E>"
thousands_sep   "<U002C>"
grouping        3;3
END LC_NUMERIC

2/ sudo locale-gen
3/ reboot computer and check:
locale -k LC_NUMERIC

2/ sudo locale-gen

body:
I got the same problem with import tensorflow.contrib.keras as K resulting in identical error message as being reported here. 
System and related details:
Linux Mint 18.2; TF r1.2; Python 3.6

And indeed changing the decimal separator made everything work as it supposed.
1/ edit locale file located /usr/share/i18n/locales/
 ```
LC_NUMERIC
decimal_point   "<U002E>"
thousands_sep   "<U002C>"
grouping        3;3
END LC_NUMERIC
```
2/ sudo locale-gen
3/ reboot computer and check:
`locale -k LC_NUMERIC`
